directions: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork and parsley; cook and stir until pork is browned on the outside, and cooked through. Remove from the heat and set aside.

Make a bed of spinach on individual serving plates or on a large platter. Arrange slices of pear over the spinach. Top with the cooked pork and sprinkle with walnuts. Drizzle the balsamic vinaigrette over the whole salad.
ingredients: 1 pound pork tenderloin, cut into 1 inch cubes
1/2 cup balsamic vinaigrette salad dressing, or to taste
title: Pork, Pear and Walnut Salad
